item.title: Cars vs. People in the United States
item.description: Rugged individualism is the frequently touted idea that in the United States, you succeed solely on your own merits, accepting no handouts. The philosophy has been steadily ingrained in the American psyche since the conception of the country, which was sold to immigrants as a place where social and economic mobility exists through hard work alone. Most will be familiar with the concept by another glamorized term: the “American Dream”.
